intro: Fibigia macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited fibigia, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Fibigia macrocarpa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
